title: "Veigar has been nuked from orbit"
body: This is something that was said on LCK this morning by monte cristo. I personally do not care for the little blue guy, it dosen't matter to me what happens. But when it's said he is gonna get compensation buffs, and it's that blatantly obvious that it's a nerf.... There is an issue beyond the specific champion there.

replies.body: I still don't get why they decided to render him to shit tier

> [{quoted}](name=TotesOnSteam,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=G4PFgEHR,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-07T00:54:37.051+0000)
>
> I still don't get why they decided to render him to shit tier

He was starting to be played as a support, which would limit the amount of Kalista picks.  Riot couldn't let that happen to their new overloaded, hyper-mobile, #LCSBigPlays monstrosity so they wrecked him.  It's the same reason all of Lee Sin's competition is getting nerfed and Zed continues to outclass the vast majority of mid laners, a number that is constantly growing.

They want to give a select number of champions the entire spotlight to work with while others are left in the dark because they're boring to watch, or crowd the limelight of their preferred stars like poor Veigar was doing.  Even if they claim that isn't the case, we've been watching, and we've been judging - it's obvious they play favorites, they just refuse to admit it.

> [{quoted}](name=TotesOnSteam,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=G4PFgEHR,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-07T00:54:37.051+0000)

> I still don't get why they decided to render him to shit tier

I don't get why people are still surprised by this, They've done it several times in the past. They've even kept champion purposely at the bottom so they would be played a s little as possible for years.
examples?

Eve
Urgot
Poppy
Olaf

Lets see...

Riot has repeatedly said they are working on buffs for Urgot to make him viable.

Poppy is viable and they are reworking her as we speak.

Olaf is also viable rn; Riot knows this and thus is not buffing him

The only champ here that Riot "purposely kept on the bottom" is evelynn.  And that is because her kit is overwhelmingly hard to balance.

I don't have any opinions on this issue, but I find it funny that you missed this, considering the topic and what you are arguing.

> Poppy is viable and they are reworking her as we speak.

"Poppy is viable"
"they are reworking her as we speak."

Good catch, to clear this up. 
She is viable in that she can be played, but mostly in solo queue. I'm not sure what's the trick to make her work without dying of constant harass in lane. But apparently it's doable.
 They are reworking her because he design is problematic. She is a potential Eve right now (or veigar), morello said this himself, if she gets viable enough that she starts hitting competitive play, they are removing her like they did eve. 

So yeah, she is playable in term of powerlevel. She is being reworked because of her design. And she is an example of champ they did/will remove from play because they don't want to see her played.
i dont see your point kind sir.  Poppy is viable, and last i checked, she was being reworked

> Riot has repeatedly said they are working on buffs for Urgot to make him viable.

After rendering him shit tier, but go on...

> Poppy is viable and they are reworking her as we speak.

If she was viable she wouldn't be considered shit tier by LCS standards would she? But please, continue...

> Olaf is also viable rn; Riot knows this and thus is not buffing him

Once again, considered shit tier by the pros = shit tier, no matter how many low ELO games you can pubstomp with him...

> The only champ here that Riot "purposely kept on the bottom" is evelynn. And that is because her kit is overwhelmingly hard to balance.

It's not hard to balance, they just dislike stealth as a whole. But somehow Twitch has become a competitive marksmen despite his stealth being True Stealth as opposed to Eve's half baked stealth.

hey, guess what asshole? Competitive does NOT equal viable.

There's a reason swain isn't played in the LCS. and yet he dominates solo q.
{{champion:6}} Is my main, don't question master nipples.

Don't forget examples from the past, like pre-Heimer rework, and pre-Eve rework. Lot of good that Eve rework did her so that she ended up right back where she started, eh? 

There was also the time Jungle Alistar got big, so they nuked that straight down. Then Soraka was considered a "toxic support" because of all of her sustain, and so proceeded to nerf her. Repeatedly. 

Then there was pre-Katarina rework where she was in awful point, though possibly without Riot's intent to nerf her to that point. 

Point being: This has been going for some time now, and from the looks of it, the train has no station coming up quite yet.

What happened to veigar is honestly worse than what happened to olaf.

Think about it.

It took years for olaf to become viable again too, and to make it worse, This was specifically supposed to be a BUFF.

Jesus Riot, He better be fixed within the next 2 patches, not two years.

Was it an orbital drop kick? cuz that's what it felt like to all us veigar players. :/

In other news, after these "compensation buffs" for veig's "compensation" he will now comfortably shift over from single-target burst mage to a more homogenized poke-mage-with-some-burst role.
RIOT LIED, VEIGAR DIED.

practice and paper are very different

.75 seconds sounds pretty miniscule but once you see that tell once, there's just no getting hit by that stun

a good buff would be to maybe fatten the stun inward a touch so that a well-placed Dark Matter becomes far more difficult to dodge within the trap-- that way you either avoid stun inside and get shot, or you make the jump to get out and possibly get caught out

champs with hard mobility need not apply, we're not talking about you big fat nerd losers and we never will, go find some balance to skew
he's white and gold...

He isn't gutted. Stop QQing. They finally made a way to outplay his stun. His Q, with the correct positioning can now farm 2 creeps at once and can now be used as a harass tool while getting cs at the same time. The reason Montecristo said that was because Veigar was being played as a 100% pick ban rate support in OGN, but now that they changed the stun, there's outplay potential and actually requires timing and skill to land it. I await my downvote from Veigar mains and the circle jerkers who always cry about champs being gutted, but find out they're still strong af the next month.

I'm not gonna say Vegiar is useless, because he simply isn't. So, yeah, it's true he can still be played, but that doesn't mean Riot didn't do a bad when they were supposed to buff him.

Before you consider me just another circle-jerker, I *completely agree* with the change to his stun, although when combined with the cast time, any champion can literally **walk** from the center of it and out of it before the cage comes up. Riot is fixing that next patch though, so everything about that is fine. 

No, what bothers me is not the stun, but *Dark Matter.* It's basically the most unreliable skill in the game right now, since you can't stun your opponent and the skill is 98% guaranteed to miss any semi-competent enemy. The lower cooldown and mana cost is nice, but... It doesn't really help when the AoE is about the size of Syndra's Q, but has over twice the delay, *Especially* consider that **Syndra can miss her Q.** To make matters worse, Dark Matter is *literally* a third of Veigar's damage.

Since day 1, that's been the only thing about Veigar's "Buff" I've been salty about. And quite frankly, I still am a bit, but it's not gonna stop me from playing my favourite evil yordle! I'll probably just be playing Viktor a bit more now.

"Do you want to be stunned or not? if no, right click outside of the giant purple circle!"

Just think about how much Veigar has to move around now too. He has to land his stun, and if successful has to move around the minions to be able to use his new Q as well. This is too much for an immobile champ. IMO his stun should last for 5 seconds considering how hard it is to land now, and even if you do land it you're probably not going to be able to do much aside from dropping the W.

Timing and skill to land his stun?

It requires Veigar's OPPONENT to severely misplay to land his stun!

Landing Veigar's stun is not a matter of skill anymore, it's all about making blatant and atrocious mistakes.
